intro: Cephaelis iodotricha, commonly known as the blue poppy, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It is characterized by its striking blue-violet petals and is often found in alpine meadows at high altitudes. The plant belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is known for its delicate, bell-shaped flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and requires well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections worldwide.
